description: Product backlog for autonomous sprint execution

stories.user_story: As an Agentic AI System, I need an AI Architect agent who can design and validate CrewAI agent systems, evaluate technical decisions, and ensure architectural quality, so that our agent-based systems follow best practices and scale effectively
acceptance_criteria: [ ] Given system design requirements, When AI Architect analyzes them, Then produces architectural diagrams and design documents following CrewAI/AutoGen patterns
[ ] Given agent configuration, When AI Architect reviews it, Then validates role, goal, backstory, tools, and provides optimization recommendations
[ ] Given multi-agent workflow, When AI Architect evaluates it, Then identifies potential bottlenecks, suggests improvements, and validates communication patterns
[ ] Given technical decision options, When AI Architect analyzes trade-offs, Then provides evidence-based recommendation with pros/cons and risk assessment
[ ] Given existing agent system, When AI Architect audits it, Then produces quality report with architecture compliance score >85%
[ ] Quality: Agent leverages CrewAI documentation, AutoGen patterns, and industry examples (no reinvention of wheel)
[ ] Quality: Design decisions include references to proven patterns from crewAI-examples repository
[ ] Quality: Architectural reviews complete in <30 min per system

quality_requirements.content_quality: All architectural decisions must reference industry patterns from CrewAI, AutoGen, or established multi-agent frameworks. Design documents must include visual diagrams (Mermaid/ASCII)
quality_requirements.performance: Architectural reviews complete in <30 minutes per system. Design generation <15 minutes
quality_requirements.security: Review security implications of agent-to-agent communication patterns, validate credential management in tool integrations
quality_requirements.maintainability: Create reusable architectural decision records (ADRs). Maintain pattern library for common agent configurations

po_decisions.authority_boundaries: Agent autonomy for technical implementation decisions (LLM selection, communication patterns, execution modes). Human PO approval required for framework adoption and major architecture changes.
po_decisions.framework_scope: Phase 1 (Sprint 10-11): CrewAI-focused with deep expertise. Phase 2 (Sprint 12+): Expand to framework-agnostic capabilities.
po_decisions.documentation_format: Hybrid approach: ADR format for decisions, C4 diagrams for system architecture, Mermaid syntax for inline diagrams.

stories.implementation_notes:
Key Skills to Incorporate:

1. AGENT DESIGN PATTERNS (from CrewAI):
   - Role/Goal/Backstory definition best practices
   - Tool selection and integration patterns
   - Memory and context management strategies
   - Reasoning and planning capabilities
   - Code execution modes (safe/unsafe)
   - Multi-modal agent configurations

2. ORCHESTRATION PATTERNS:
   - Sequential vs Hierarchical vs Graph-based flows
   - Task delegation and handoff strategies
   - State management in complex workflows
   - Human-in-the-loop integration points
   - Error handling and retry strategies

3. SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE:
   - Multi-agent communication patterns
   - Crew composition and team structures
   - Agent specialization vs generalization trade-offs
   - Performance optimization (context windows, rate limits, caching)
   - Testing strategies for agent systems

4. TECHNICAL DECISION EVALUATION:
   - LLM selection criteria (GPT-4 vs GPT-4o-mini vs Claude)
   - When to use function calling vs tools
   - Safe vs unsafe code execution trade-offs
   - Memory/knowledge source strategies
   - Framework integration patterns (LangGraph, AutoGen)

5. QUALITY VALIDATION:
   - Agent configuration review checklist
   - System architecture compliance validation
   - Performance metrics and monitoring
   - Security review for tool integrations
   - Documentation completeness checks

REFERENCE EXAMPLES (Don't Reinvent):
- CrewAI docs: Agent attributes, flows, best practices
- AutoGen: AssistantAgent, UserProxyAgent, GroupChat patterns
- crewAI-examples: Marketing strategy, content creator flow, lead scoring
- Microsoft patterns: Orchestrator agents, specialized workers

IMPLEMENTATION APPROACH:
1. Create .github/agents/architect.agent.md specification
2. Define tool set: CrewAI docs access, pattern library, ADR templates
3. Configure with reasoning=true for strategic planning
4. Enable knowledge_sources for framework documentation
5. Test with real system designs from Sprint 9-10 roadmap
stories.request: Build an Agentic AI Architect agent with skills from industry best practices (CrewAI, AutoGen). Do not reinvent the wheel - leverage existing patterns.
